title: 10 Days: Pacific Coast Road Trip
subtitle: Sun, Surf, and Seafood from Puerto Vallarta to Oaxaca
meta_title: Pacific Coast Mexico 10-Day Itinerary - Complete Road Trip Guide 2025
meta_description: The ultimate Pacific Mexico road trip: Puerto Vallarta, Sayulita, Oaxaca, Puerto Escondido. 10 days of beaches, surf towns, mezcal, and incredible cuisine. Complete day-by-day guide.
hero_alt: Surfer riding a wave on Mexico's Pacific Coast at sunset
introduction: Mexico's Pacific Coast offers a dramatically different experience from the Caribbean: crashing surf, golden sunsets, bohemian beach towns, and some of the country's best cuisine in Oaxaca. This 10-day itinerary combines the resort energy of Puerto Vallarta with the surf culture of Sayulita and the cultural depth of Oaxaca, finishing at the legendary beaches of Puerto Escondido.
best_time: November to April for dry season; July-September for bigger surf
highlights: Watch sunset from Puerto Vallarta's Malecón
See giant waves at Zicatela Beach

days.title: Arrive in Puerto Vallarta
days.description: Arrive at Puerto Vallarta International Airport (PVR) and transfer to your hotel in the Zona Romántica. Spend the afternoon walking the famous Malecón boardwalk with its sculptures and ocean views. Watch the sunset over Banderas Bay—one of Mexico's most spectacular.
tips: Zona Romántica is the best area for walkability and restaurants
Los Muertos Beach is the main beach—grab a chair at a beach club
Friday evenings have art walks in galleries

days.title: Puerto Vallarta Exploration
days.description: Morning at Los Muertos Beach, then explore the historic Centro with its iconic church and cobblestone streets. Take a boat trip to the hidden beaches of Las Caletas or Yelapa, accessible only by water. Return for dinner at one of Vallarta's excellent restaurants.
activities: Boat trip to Yelapa or Las Caletas
tips: Yelapa is more rustic, Las Caletas more resort-like
Try a michelada (beer with lime and chili) on the beach
The pier area has fresh seafood at local prices

days.title: Sayulita - Surf Town
days.description: Drive to Sayulita (1 hour north), a colorful Pueblo Mágico and surf town. Check into your beachfront hotel, rent a surfboard, and hit the beginner-friendly waves. The town is walkable and vibrant with surf shops, boutiques, and excellent restaurants. Evening is for mezcal and live music.
tips: Surf lessons run about $50-70 for 2 hours with board
Main beach gets crowded—walk to Playa de los Muertos for quiet
Don Pedro's is the classic sunset spot

days.title: Sayulita & Hidden Beaches
days.description: Morning surf session, then rent a golf cart to explore nearby beaches. Visit San Pancho (San Francisco), a quieter alternative with excellent restaurants. Hike to secluded Playa del Amor or take a boat to the Marietas Islands to see the famous Hidden Beach (advance booking required).
tips: Marietas Islands tours must be booked in advance—limited daily visitors
Golf carts rent for about $50-70/day
San Pancho has better food, Sayulita better nightlife

days.title: Fly to Oaxaca City
days.description: Fly from Puerto Vallarta to Oaxaca City (with connection in Mexico City or Guadalajara, or direct on some airlines). Arrive in this UNESCO World Heritage city and check into your hotel in the historic center. Evening walk to the Zócalo for dinner and people-watching.
activities: Morning in Sayulita, drive to PVR airport
Walk to Zócalo and Santo Domingo church
Dinner at Casa Oaxaca or Los Danzantes
tips: Book flights early—Oaxaca is popular
Centro Histórico is walkable—stay there
Oaxaca is at 5,000 feet elevation—you may notice the altitude

days.title: Oaxaca City Immersion
days.description: Full day in Oaxaca exploring the cultural riches. Start at the incredible Santo Domingo church and adjacent Cultural Center. Visit artisan markets at Mercado Benito Juárez and Mercado 20 de Noviembre (the famous street food market). Take a cooking class to learn Oaxacan mole.
activities: Santo Domingo church and Cultural Center
tips: Cooking classes should be booked in advance
Try the chocolate at Mayordomo
In Situ is the best mezcal bar in Mexico

days.title: Hierve el Agua & Mezcal
days.description: Day trip to the Oaxaca Valley. Visit Monte Albán archaeological site if you didn't yesterday, then continue to Mitla's unique geometric stonework. Stop at mezcal distilleries in Matatlán (world capital of mezcal) and finish at Hierve el Agua—petrified waterfalls with infinity pool views over the valley.
activities: Monte Albán ruins (sunrise for fewest crowds)
Hierve el Agua swimming and sunset
tips: Rent a car or hire a driver for flexibility ($60-80 for the day)
Don't buy mezcal at the first stop—compare at several
Hierve el Agua is best at sunset but remote roads—leave time

days.title: Travel to Puerto Escondido
days.description: Drive or fly to Puerto Escondido on Oaxaca's coast. The mountain drive (6 hours) is stunning but winding; flights (40 minutes) are affordable. Arrive at this legendary surf town and settle into La Punta, the bohemian southern end with yoga, healthy food, and beach bars.
activities: Morning in Oaxaca or early departure
tips: Flying is much easier than driving—road is curves the whole way
La Punta has the vibe; Zicatela has the big waves; Centro has the town
Carrizalillo is the calmest swimming beach

days.title: Puerto Escondido Beach Life
days.description: Full day experiencing Puerto Escondido's beaches. Watch the massive Zicatela waves (surfing for experts only), swim at protected Playa Carrizalillo, take a surf lesson at La Punta, or try a SUP tour through the mangroves. Evening is for the famous bioluminescence boat tour.
activities: Watch big wave surfers at Zicatela
tips: Don't swim at Zicatela—the waves and currents are deadly for non-experts
Bioluminescence tours run around $30—book at Laguna de Manialtepec
Sea turtle releases happen some evenings July-December

days.title: Departure
days.description: Final morning in Puerto Escondido. Enjoy one last sunrise on the beach, a yoga class, or fresh fruit at the mercado. Fly out of Puerto Escondido's small airport, connecting through Mexico City or Oaxaca to your international flight.
tips: Puerto Escondido airport is tiny but has connections to CDMX and Oaxaca
Allow buffer for flight connections—delays are common
Some travelers add Huatulco for 1-2 more beach days

practical_info.getting_there: Start in Puerto Vallarta (PVR) with many US/Canada direct flights. End in Puerto Escondido (PXM) with connections via Mexico City or Oaxaca. Internal flights are affordable on Viva Aerobus or Volaris.
practical_info.getting_around: Rent a car in Puerto Vallarta for the Sayulita area. In Oaxaca, hire drivers for day trips or rent a car for flexibility. Puerto Escondido is walkable/taxi. Internal flights are recommended over long drives.

faqs.question: Can beginners surf on this trip?
faqs.answer: Yes! Sayulita and La Punta (Puerto Escondido) have beginner-friendly waves with surf schools. Zicatela's giant waves are for experts only—but amazing to watch.

faqs.question: How do I get from the Pacific coast to Oaxaca?
faqs.answer: Fly. The mountain drive from Puerto Vallarta or Puerto Escondido to Oaxaca is 6-8 hours of winding roads. Short, affordable flights save time and hassle.

faqs.question: Is 10 days enough for this itinerary?
faqs.answer: 10 days is comfortable but moves quickly. If you want more relaxation, skip one destination or add 2-3 days. Many travelers wish they had more time in Oaxaca especially.

faqs.question: What's the best time for Pacific coast surf?
faqs.answer: November to April has cleaner waves and offshore winds. July-September brings bigger south swells for advanced surfers. December-February is peak season with highest prices.
